title: Request to DEA for production assistance agreements between 2017 and 2023

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to DEA for production assistance agreements between 2017 and 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any production assistance agreements signed by the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) with any film or television productions, inclusive of the years 2017-2023.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: DEA FOIA/PA Case Number: 24-00589-F
communications.communication:
Dear Brett Carollo: This e-mail responds to your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request dated March 7, 2024, received by the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), FOIA/PA Unit, seeking access to DEA records.  Your request has been opened and assigned the following case number: 24-00589-F.  Please include this case number when communicating with this office. The records you seek require searches in another office or offices, and so your request falls within "unusual circumstances."  See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii).  Because of these unusual circumstances, we are extending the time limit to respond to your request beyond the ten additional days provided by the statute.  We have not yet completed a search to determine whether there are records within the scope of your request.  The time needed to process your request will necessarily depend on the complexity of our records search and on the volume and complexity of any records located.  For your information, this office assigns incoming requests to one of three tracks:  simple, complex, or expedited.  Each request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to other requests in the same track.  Simple requests usually receive a response in approximately one month, whereas complex requests take longer than a month to complete.  At this time, your request has been assigned to the complex track.  You may wish to narrow the scope of your request to limit the number of potentially responsive records or agree to an alternative time frame for processing, should records be located; or you may wish to await the completion of our records search to discuss either of these options. We regret the necessity of this delay, but please be assured that your request will be processed as soon as possible.  If you have any questions or wish to discuss reformulation or an alternative time frame for the processing of your request, you may contact our FOIA Requester Service Center at (571) 776-2300, or e-mail your correspondence to DEA.FOIA@dea.gov. In addition, you may wish to visit our website at www.dea.gov to determine if the information you are requesting is already available to the public.  You may contact our FOIA Public Liaison at (571) 776-2300 for any further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at (202) 741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at (202) 741-5769. Sincerely, 
FOIA/PA Unit FOIA & Information Law Section Office of Chief Counsel Drug Enforcement Administration 
PRIVACY ACT NOTICE:  This e-mail (including any attachments herein) may contain personal and privileged information that requires protection in compliance with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a).  Any use of this information by anyone other than the intended recipient is prohibited.  If you have received this communication in error, please immediately delete all copies of this information and notify me by e-mail.  The use, dissemination, distribution, or reproduction of this communication by unintended recipients is not authorized and may be unlawful.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-00589-F
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

This message pertains to FOIA request #24-00589-F. I wish to appeal the finding that the requested records are exempt from FOIA release. It does not seem reasonable that general information about official DEA collaborations with feature films or TV shows would meet the exemption requirements. 

If the appeal is rejected, I request (in order to help inform future FOIA requests with DEA) to know if DEA considers any and all information pertaining to collaborations between DEA and the entertainment industry exempt from FOIA.

Thank you.

Brett Carollo

title: Request to FBI for all 2024 movie collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to FBI for all 2024 movie collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the Federal Bureau of Investigation has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2024. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports, production assistance agreements, or similar internal documents. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices, public affairs offices, and communications HQ.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Public Records Request - HSMV

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - HSMV
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:

https://www.wfla.com/news/hillsborough-county/suspected-drunken-largo-woman-grabs-troopers-genitals-bites-leg-after-i-4-crash-fhp/


Exact date of incident: Sep 29, 2024

Names of parties involved: Tyshera Williams

Location: I-4 in Tampa


I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

title: Durno East Palestine 1

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Durno East Palestine 1
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all emails, including attachments, sent or received by East Palestine disaster response coordinator Mark Durno that contain one or more of the following words or phrases: "dioxin", "dioxins", "vinyl chloride", "burn", "burned", and/or "Norfolk Southern". This request seeks records produced between February 1 2023 through April 1, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

communications.subject: FOIA Tracking Number Change for request EPA-2023-006711 (to EPA-R5-2023-006711)
communications.communication:
The FOIA request EPA-2023-006711 has had its Tracking Number changed to EPA-R5-2023-006711.  This is normally due to the request being transferred to another agency (for example, EPA to Dept. of Commerce) or to a sub-agency to process it. Additional details for this request are as follows: 
 
  * Old Tracking Number:
					EPA-2023-006711 
  * New Tracking Number:
					EPA-R5-2023-006711 
  * Requester Name:
					Jimmy Tobias 
  * Date Submitted:
					09/18/2023 
  * Long Description:
					To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Any and all emails, including attachments, sent or received by East Palestine disaster response coordinator Mark Durno that contain one or more of the following words or phrases: "dioxin", "dioxins", "vinyl chloride", "burn", "burned", and/or "Norfolk Southern". This request seeks records produced between February 1 2023 through April 1, 2023. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Jimmy Tobias

communications.subject: EPA FOIA Public Access Link Invitation; Notice of Sending of System-Generated FOIAXpress Email Public Access Link Invitation to Create Requester Account
communications.communication:
To the U.S. EPA FOIA Requester Community,

Some in the EPA Requester community have encountered problems creating FOIAXpress Public Access Link (PAL) accounts in the Agency's new FOIA application FOIAXpress.   With the FOIAXpress application, the PAL is the best method for EPA to release voluminous records to our Requesters, without encountering MB-limiting firewalls and such transmission impediments.

The Agency is working diligently to solve this FOIAXpress issue.  In the interim, we have taken the step to "push" a system-generated invitation to create a PAL account to you.  You should receive an email from address noreply_nfo@epa.gov<mailto:noreply_nfo@epa.gov> with instructions on how to take the next steps to successfully establish the PAL account.

If you chose to establish this account, this would then ensure that all future interim and final responses from your FOIA requests to EPA will be available for download via the PAL.  It will also allow you to submit any new requests to U.S. EPA using your PAL account.
Regards,
Rebecca Clausen, on behalf of the
EPA FOIAXpress Implementation Team

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #EPA-R5-2023-006711
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

Per the correspondence sent on 2/15/2024, the due date for this request has been set to 5/31/2024.

As you may know, EPA has received numerous requests regarding the East Palestine Train Derailment, including requests that have been granted expedited processing which will be processed before your request. EPA has also made interim releases and released thousands of pages of records since February 2023, which can be found here: https://cumulis.epa.gov/supercpad/CurSites/cscdocument.cfm?id=0521908&doc=Y&colid=42384. EPA is still diligently working to process your request and appreciates your patience.

Please reach out if you have any additional questions.

Thank you,

Krishna Bhatt (She/Her)
Attorney-Advisor|National FOIA Office<https://www.epa.gov/foia/forms/contact-us-about-freedom-information-act-and-foia-requests>

title: CD of Testimony Taken During US Navy Court of Inquiry into USS Liberty Attack

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CD of Testimony Taken During US Navy Court of Inquiry into USS Liberty Attack
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the IDF attacked our ship on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

In June, 1967 the US Navy convened a Court of Inquiry to look into the June 8, 1967 attack on the USS Liberty.

Testimony taken by the court was recorded on a Dictaphone which was later converted to CD.

I am requesting a copy of the CD that contains the testimony before the US Navy Court of Inquiry into the attack on the USS Liberty.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

title: Commonweath Equity Audity Quarterly Reports

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Commonweath Equity Audity Quarterly Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all Quarterly reports following the Commonwealth's Equity Audit for the Period July 1, 2021, to Present.

These reports were mandatory as a result of the Barnes and Thornburg Investigation.

According to the  "Quarterly Report 1 - Commonwealth's Equity Audit July 1, 2021 - December 15, 2021"   (Attached):  "VMI began submitting 'quarterly reports' to the BOV for follow-on submission to SCHEV and the
Virginia Military Institute and the General Assembly on 15 December 2021, and will continue this practice for the next three years."

These lawfully required documents must exist and should be readily available.

If VMI discontinued providing these mandatory reports at any time or failed to submit one or more of the required reports I request records showing who in the appropriate position of authority made the decision to stop reporting and the basis for that decision as well as the notificationsto the proper agencies and offices to which these mandatory reports were to be submitted (BOV, GA, SCHEV, etc.) as well as the associated approval to end or otherwise limit this mandatory requirement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: GA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Lumpkin County Election And Registration Office)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Lumpkin County Election And Registration Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the Dominion voting system. Forsyth County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report” at this link: https://www.forsythco.com/Departments-Offices/Voter-Registrations-Elections/Election-Results. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Cochise County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Cochise County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to all staff—both medical and correctional—related to handling or managing prisoners with blood borne pathogens including but not limited Hepatitis C or HIV/AIDS.  This could be in the form of training materials on how to quarantine individuals with blood borne pathogens, or training materials for correctional staff on what to do when coming into contact with someone who has a blood borne pathogen. 

2- Any emergency preparedness manuals, directives, or training materials for when a viral outbreak occurs (this could also be referred to as a “pandemic procedure".)

3- Any medical directives, memos, regulations, or staff training around prescribing the medical protocol of PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis).

4- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to staff on housing criteria for specific populations (e.g. women, youth, those with illnesses, etc.)

5- Employee handbook given to correctional staff upon hiring, as well as any employee handbook given separately to medical staff

I am also requesting the following data and forms:

1- Aggregate data by month on the number of prisoners with HIV and Hep C for the last two years. If this data exists only in a format that requires creation of a new record, please provide the data in its original format and remove identifying information.

2- A copy of the standard medical intake form used for prisoners or people held inside the facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Joseph Darius Jaafari

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Nevada Department of Corrections)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Nevada Department of Corrections)

MuckRock

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Nevada Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Elizondo-Pinochi: 

I  previously submitted a public records request to the Nevada Department of Corrections (NDOC) regarding current mental health staff. I was informed that NDOC does not maintain these records and that the Department of Administration (specifically Human Resources) is the custodian, to which I submitted a public records request.

However, the DOA has now replied stating they are not the custodian and referred me back to NDOC. To simplify the request and avoid unnecessary burden, I’d like to narrow the scope to a single question:

Could you kindly provide the name(s) and contact information (email or phone) for the individual or individuals responsible for overseeing mental health or behavioral health programming within Nevada Department of Corrections facilities — such as a Chief Psychologist, Mental Health Director, or similar supervisory role?
	•	Full name
	•	Job title
	•	Assigned facility
	•	Work email and/or phone number (if available)
	•	Department (e.g. Behavioral Health)

I understand many services are contracted out — if that’s the case, any direction you could offer (e.g. relevant points of contact at the contracting entity) would be greatly appreciated. 

For context: I’m reaching out as part of a nonprofit initiative exploring the possibility of offering free meditation-based rehabilitation programming to incarcerated populations across the U.S., including Nevada. Similar programs have been successfully implemented in state and federal prisons in the U.S. and abroad, with evidence showing significant benefits to inmate well-being and facility safety.

Thank you again for your time and support.

Warm regards,
Andrew Ma

title: Police Book Reports (Pembroke Pines Police Department)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Police Book Reports (Pembroke Pines Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any police report, complaint (including by parents, students, citizens, or officials), or investigative records concerning the content of any books, materials, or events at a library. This includes any public library or school library.

2. Any photographs, videos, or other evidence/documents referenced in the report, complaint, or investigative records.

This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Pembroke Pines, FL Request :: W132344-060225
communications.communication:
Dear Adam, 
 Thank you for using our online portal to submit your OTHER PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS request. You have been provided the following reference number to assist you in accessing the request online as well as directing any inquires to our office: W132344-060225. 
 We will process your request and contact you when your order is complete. 
 You can login to your account at any time to view the current status of your request or to obtain responsive records that may have been released to you by CLICKING HERE. communications.subject: OTHER PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS :: W132344-060225
communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Steinbaugh, 
The Pembroke Pines Police Department is in response to your public records request to obtain the following information: On May 24, 2023: 
Subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Police Book Reports (Pembroke Pines Police Department) 
To Whom It May Concern: 
Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records: 
1. Any police report, complaint (including by parents, students, citizens, or officials), or investigative records concerning the content of any books, materials, or events at a library. This includes any public library or school library. 
2. Any photographs, videos, or other evidence/documents referenced in the report, complaint, or investigative records. 
This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2020. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 
Sincerely, 
Adam Steinbaugh 
Please be advised we are currently in the process of researching and gathering any documents responsive to your request. 
Kind Regards, 
Melissa Wollard 
Records Manager 
Pembroke Pines Police Department-Records Unit 
954-431-2709

title: Evergreen Solutions (Niagara County Community College)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Niagara County Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

files.source: Niagara County Community College, Niagara County, NY

communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,
I have the answers to your questions. 

1. Is the salary structure reflective of all the employees? Meaning these are all the employees who work at the institution? Wanted to ask since there were only 48 positions.

Answer: The information provided was for Administrators. All other employees are in a CBA. 

- Is there anything to indicate the actual salary and their FTE? 

Answer: That is the actual salary as FTE. 

2. Are these "groups" official pay grades for the employees?

Answer: There are ranges based on benchmarking for recruitment and retention. 

3. Are there job descriptions for these staff positions?

Answer: Only have job descriptions for Administrators. Clerical (ESPA), Security (ESPA) Maintenance and Operations (TSPA) is civil service: https://www.niagaracounty.gov/employment/job_specs_for_civil_service_positions.php. Rates are also in the CBA’s that were already provided, and faculty is in the handbook which is attached as well. 


Please let me know if there is anything else needed.

Thank You,
Kristin Leszkowicz

communications.communication:
Greetings,

Thank you for the clarification, I have some additional questions/clarifications:

1. Is the salary structure reflective of all the employees? Meaning these are all the employees who work at the institution? Wanted to ask since there were only 48 positions.

Answer: The information provided was for Administrators. All other employees are in a CBA.

Follow Up: Is it possible to get a copy of that? The current one does not show non-faculty positions with the salaries

2. Is there anything to indicate the actual salary and their FTE?

Answer: That is the actual salary as FTE.
Follow-up: When I ask about "FTE" I mean if these positions are full time or part time. Also, by actual salary, I mean the actual amount the employee earns, and not potential like the ranges indicate. 

Thank you so much.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Niagara County Community College)
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

I was not able to submit my responses to this request via the link in the email, therefore, I am including them in this email in red with an attachment. Please let me know that you have received this response.


1. Is the salary structure reflective of all the employees? Meaning these are all the employees who work at the institution? Wanted to ask since there were only 48 positions. The salary structure is for Administrators (non-union)  only as listed. The other ranges are part of the CBA which was provided.

Answer: The information provided was for Administrators. All other employees are in a CBA.

Follow Up: Is it possible to get a copy of that? The current one does not show non-faculty positions with the salaries Attached

2. Is there anything to indicate the actual salary and their FTE?

Answer: That is the actual salary as FTE.
Follow-up: When I ask about "FTE" I mean if these positions are full time or part time. Also, by actual salary, I mean the actual amount the employee earns, and not potential like the ranges indicate. Full-time which equates to a minimum of 35 hours per week.

Thank You,

Kristin Leszkowicz
Assistant to the President
SUNY Niagara
716-614-5902

These are typically posted on the VMI Website, and they should be readily available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Nevada DOC transgender policies

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Ileana Garnand

title: ArtCarve and other business dealing reports

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: ArtCarve and other business dealing reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Freedom of Information Act this request is for all documents and/or records involving any communications, procurements, and/or any other actions involving any member of the Virginia Military Institute Faculty, staff, administration, employee, cadet, organization (including Cadet Clubs) on any subject with the companies known as ArtCarved, Balfour, Herff Jones, or Jostens for the period 1 August 2023 to the date of this FOIA.

For the purpose of this request, “Documents and/or Records” is defined as “Any public record subject to disclosure under the Va. FOIA including any writing or recording, paper record, electronic file, audio, video recording, or any other format. This term shall mean all relevant data and information in the Custodian’s possession defined in [a] Requester’s General Subject of Inquiry and [b] Specific Subjects of Inquiry including but not limited to letters, notes, drafts, legal instruments, contracts, telephone transcripts, email correspondence, drawings and tables. Includes, without limitation, any and all forms of memorialized information, whether written, graphic, computerized, or stored electronically or on tape.  This definition specifically includes, but is not limited to, drafts, originals, copies, handwritten notes or comments, letters, correspondence, e-mails, records of discussions, memoranda, telegrams, telephone logs and records, teletypes, appointment books, meeting agenda or minutes, reports, briefings, presentations, studies, analyses, communications with government bodies, interoffice and intra-office communications with any party whatsoever, computer programs and printouts, social media communications, including, but not limited, to FaceTime, Instagram, FaceBook.com, text messages, and other records or voice records, films or tapes As well as any screenshots or other record showing calls of which there are no other records were made.”

For the purposed of this FOIA documents involving cadets and their activities related to these companies are not student records as defined by FERPA and, therefore, cannot be withheld.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.communication: This response appears incomplete as it does not contain any records/documents (as defined above) related to communications between VMI and the Yearbook company (emails, etc.) as well as emails and responses from VMI officies to and from the Bomb Staff and/or cadets. Undertand that like the spreasdsheet for orders the personal information such as home addresses for cadets would be redacted. In addition, since the yearbook is an official VMI activitity and not an independent publication, the emails and other records to and from the cadet staff and the company and/or administration officials are public documents.  It just appears this response is incomplete as it creates the impression there was no other communications between the staff, the administration, and.or the company.  There should rasonably be some since it is normal practice that yearbook proofs are created, revised (if necessary), approved, diaspproved, etc. Please clarify and, if needed, fully respond to thee request.

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The exact number of people who are 

1) on both the sex offender registry and probation; and
2) on both the sex offender registry and parole;

as per the latest available data is requested.

If this cannot be provided, I request records that include:

The list of people on probation
The list of people on parole
The list of people on the sex offender registry

as per the latest available data. 

If this data is held by another agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

title: sUAS Operations (2024-2025)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: sUAS Operations (2024-2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Mission documentation of each sUAS deployment in 2024-2025 so far, sufficient to determine the date, time, location, and purpose of each deployment. Please see P135695-041424, a similar request, for reference.

If this is not available, an index with file name, date created, location (if available), length, and any other available metadata of video files created as a result of sUAS deployments in 2023.

2. Any available CAD data and dispatch communications regarding any incident in which KCSO deployed sUAS to assist Seattle PD/SPD SWAT in 2024/2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P154140-032625
communications.communication:
Thank you for your interest in obtaining public records held by the King County Sheriff’s Office. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on March 26, 2025 and given the reference number P154140-032625 for tracking purposes. 
 
Within five (5) business days (excluding holidays) after receiving your request, we will: 
 
 
  * Provide the record(s); 
  * Or Acknowledge your request and give you a reasonable estimate of how long it will take to respond; 
  * Or Deny the request in writing, stating the reasons for the denial (this could also include a denial of part of your request and a granting of the remainder). 
The day the request is received does not count as one of the five (5) days. Weekends and holidays observed by the agency are also excluded in the calculation. 
 
Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Mission documentation of each sUAS deployment in 2024-2025 so far, sufficient to determine the date, time, location, and purpose of each deployment. Please see P135695-041424, a similar request, for reference.

If this is not available, an index with file name, date created, location (if available), length, and any other available metadata of video files created as a result of sUAS deployments in 2023.

2. Any available CAD data and dispatch communications regarding any incident in which KCSO deployed sUAS to assist Seattle PD/SPD SWAT in 2024/2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Subject: Public Disclosure Request Reference# P154140-032625 Thank you for your request made via the King County Sheriff’s Office (KCSO) Online Request System on March 26, 2025. You requested: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1. Mission documentation of each sUAS deployment in 2024-2025 so far, sufficient to determine the date, time, location, and purpose of each deployment. Please see P135695-041424, a similar request, for reference. 

If this is not available, an index with file name, date created, location (if available), length, and any other available metadata of video files created as a result of sUAS deployments in 2023. 

2. Any available CAD data and dispatch communications regarding any incident in which KCSO deployed sUAS to assist Seattle PD/SPD SWAT in 2024/2025. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1. Mission documentation of each sUAS deployment in 2024-2025 so far, sufficient to determine the date, time, location, and purpose of each deployment. Please see P135695-041424, a similar request, for reference. 

If this is not available, an index with file name, date created, location (if available), length, and any other available metadata of video files created as a result of sUAS deployments in 2023. 

2. Any available CAD data and dispatch communications regarding any incident in which KCSO deployed sUAS to assist Seattle PD/SPD SWAT in 2024/2025. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fking-county-sheriffs-office-2399%252Fsuas-operations-2024-2025-183915%252F%253Femail%253Dkcso%252540mycusthelp.net&url_auth_token=AAATlj89hS1AieJUe0CdzSXz0eQ%3A1txMbf%3ABUOylGWamxz_fN4uw1dlGSJsabcdLaD-VDhxc6uCZiM 
The KCSO Public Disclosure Unit processes requests for records created, managed and maintained for unincorporated King County and our contract partners  . We have located the following record(s) responsive to your request (4 police reports, 7 CAD events, 1 radio file, and one drone report).  Please note exemptions cited for redactions within the documents attached and locate the corresponding code within the exemption log. Regarding your request for 911 call audio/radio transmissions; the master recordings for the date(s) of the responsive incident(s) are past retention and have purged from our system per the Emergency Communications  records retention schedule, so no copies of the recordings can be made. 
P154140_FULLRELEASE_06082025.zip 
Please log in to the Records Center at the following link to retrieve the record(s): 
Public Records Request - P154140-032625 Once you log in and go to your request, you will find the uploaded record(s) in the "Files" section. If you are using a mobile device and are having trouble downloading or seeing the records, we recommend using a laptop or desktop computer to access the records. To open and review PDF documents you will need an application that can view PDF documents. 
We have interpreted your request as for the drone report for KCSO between the dates of 1/1/2024 and 3/26/2025.  In addition, we have provided police reports, CAD reports and radio transmissions for SPD assist drone events.  Please advise if there are additional events you are seeking by 7/8/2025.  If we do not hear from you by that date, we will close your request as fulfilled. Your request is subject to fees as allowed under King County Ordinance 18949 and the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56.120 . Please visit our website and select "What is the cost to obtain records" for more information. Once we have determined the scope of your request and responsive records, we may provide an estimate for fees requiring 10% down prior to processing your request. 
PLEASE NOTE: Per RCW 42.56.120(4), the KCSO reserves the right to close a records request after 30 days if a requester does not inspect, view, download, and/or pick up the records we provide. There is no obligation for us to continue producing records that are not being collected by a requester. 
RCW 42.56.120(4) states that if an installment of a records request is not claimed or reviewed, the agency is not obligated to fulfill the balance of the request. 
WAC 44-14-04006(1) states that a records request has been fulfilled and can be closed if an entirely unclear request has not been clarified, a request or installment has not been claimed or reviewed, or the requestor cancels the request. Please reply to this message or log in to the Online Request System if you have any questions or would like to clarify or cancel this request. Public Disclosure Unit | Records Services Section King County Sheriff's Office 206-263-2103 | www.kingcounty.gov/sheriff

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The exact number of people who are 

1) on both the sex offender registry and probation; and
2) on both the sex offender registry and parole;

as per the latest available data is requested.

If this cannot be provided, I request records that include:

The list of people on probation
The list of people on parole
The list of people on the sex offender registry

as per the latest available data. 

If this data is held by another agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

files.title: image002
files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hi,

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Renee,

Thank you for your continued partnership on this request. Please know that we are unable to access the SharePoint link you had provided. Our email address is not showing as associated with the link: 147140-15493170@requests.muckrock.com.

Please advise at your earliest convenience.

Thank You,

MuckRock Staff

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

We apologize for the error you received while trying to access the records. We will be using another method for delivery. Attached are the instructions that you will need to connect to the ERB SFTP server.  I will send you the credentials in a secure email to follow this.

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records. We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024. Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA2C20.B2CBD790]

title: Shooting Targets (Chicago Police Department)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Shooting Targets (Chicago Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the purchase and use of targets used for marksmanship training:

Targets are defined as paper and metal targets used by the department for shooting lethal and nonlethal weapons (40mm foam rounds, tasers, etc). They can be stationary or moving. 

Purchase and invoice records for targets
Scans, photos, website links, and any record that shows what the targets look like

Search 2018 to today’s date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: P056323-051225
communications.communication:
Dear Joey : 
 
Thank you for your interest in information from the Chicago Police Department. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: P056323-051225 
You have requested the following records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the purchase and use of targets used for marksmanship training:

Targets are defined as paper and metal targets used by the department for shooting lethal and nonlethal weapons (40mm foam rounds, tasers, etc). They can be stationary or moving.

Purchase and invoice records for targets
Scans, photos, website links, and any record that shows what the targets look like

Search 2018 to today’s date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

Chicago Police Department (CPD) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the Chicago FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Joey  Scott, 
 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Chicago Public Records Portal. 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, we are excited to share with you that you can now submit FOIA requests through a newly implemented online request system. While you will still be allowed to email your FOIA requests, creating an account and submitting your request online will allow you to check the online portal for the status of requests. You will also receive an email when the records are ready to be downloaded.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request copies of all emails sent or received between 12/10/24 and 12/18/24 (inclusive) containing one or more of the terms "Deloitte", "United Health",  "IBM".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Boguslaw

title: 189 Old Hickory Boulevard Record Request

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: 189 Old Hickory Boulevard Record Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide Information available for the following property at: 189 Old Hickory Boulevard (The Hermitage)

1.Any open code violations(Building, Fire and Zoning) 
2. Certificate of occupancy 
3. Any approval documents or site plans if available

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Joshua O'fair.

title: Nevada SEA response

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Nevada SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Nevada Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: Stephen Presnull Offense Report (McLennan County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Stephen Presnull Offense Report (McLennan County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Personnel Division,

I hope this message finds you well.

I am writing to request any police reports, calls for service, and documented reprimands involving Stephen Presnull, a former employee of your organization. This information is intended for public use and will be made available to the public.

Please note that Stephen Presnull was a public servant, and the requested records are not for personal use but for transparency and public knowledge.

Thank you for your attention to this request. I look forward to your prompt response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Stephen

 Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Dear Personnel Division,

I hope this message finds you well.

I am writing to request any police reports, calls for service, and documented reprimands involving Stephen Presnull, a former employee of your organization. This information is intended for public use and will be made available to the public.

Please note that Stephen Presnull was a public servant, and the requested records are not for personal use but for transparency and public knowledge.

Sincerely,

Stephen 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
McLennan County Sheriff's Office

RE: Sheriff's Office Records Request of March 26, 2025, Reference # R000905-032625 Dear Stephen Stephen, The McLennan County Sheriff's Office received a public records request from you on March 26, 2025. Your request mentioned: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Dear Personnel Division, 

I hope this message finds you well. 

I am writing to request any police reports, calls for service, and documented reprimands involving Stephen Presnull, a former employee of your organization. This information is intended for public use and will be made available to the public. 

Please note that Stephen Presnull was a public servant, and the requested records are not for personal use but for transparency and public knowledge. 

Thank you for your attention to this request. I look forward to your prompt response. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Stephen ***** The Ag has ruled to withhold case # 24-1791, all but the basic information, which I uploaded. I also uploaded a new case, 23-0423 that will be send to the AG because it did not result in conviction. The only releasable case was uploaded to the portal, along with a copy of the AG's ruling on 24-1791. I am still waiting on HR to get back with whether or not there is any reprimands in his file and will write again once they get back with me.***** For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Lisa Foster

title: Recruitment and Hiring (Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Recruitment and Hiring (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the department's efforts to recruit and hire new officers:
Records include digital and physical, released in their native forms (Excel, PDF, etc)

- ad purchases
- contracts with vendors for ad placement, recruitment and hiring 
- market research and data, if collected
- brand and department strategies created by ad agencies or internally
- data related to applications, KPIs of recruitment and hiring campaigns
- PowerPoint or equivalent presentations, including accompanying documents related to recruitment, hiring, and marketing strategies
- Budgets for recruitment and hiring internally, and the total money spent 
- Pay bonuses or financial incentives to retain officers
- Data by year on the number of officers, sworn and non-sworn

Search from 2021 to today's date.
Please provide in rolling production

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott
